title: Bard: The Wandering Caretaker FanArt

embed.description: FINALLY DONE! Happy Birthday Bard Bard is the adorable new champion from League of Legends, coming out REAL SOON, probably TODAY ! This piece was really challenging with all the different light sou...

body:
#HAPPY (maybe) BIRTHDAY TODAY BARD!!!
Some FanArt I did, worked really hard to finish this for his release date.
.#riotdubyaathedream #noticemesenpai

replies.body:
That's really awesome :D  

Who is that in his arms that he's taken on a magical journey?  I feel I should know, but I want to ask to be sure.
He's holding his bff ADcarry Caitlyn. :D
Wow, this is awesome! I really love how you also included Caitlyn in the picture as if she's hurt and Bard saved her :)
You hit that spot on! That's exactly the idea I wanted to get across, glad you could see it :)
This piece is so amazing :U You did an amazing job on this!  :D
That is REALLY good; can't wait to see some more of your stuff :)

Thanks man, that's the greatest compliment! 
What champion(s) would you like to see next?
well, you seem to have a knack for a 'Epic Fantasy Novel Cover' style, so... maybe Lissandra or Lulu? :D (magical/mysterious/whimsical)
Awesome :)
This is awesome!
Thanks Utora! I hope I did your collective-creativity-child justice, the work Riot has put into Bard is exceptional :)
this is very nice and well done! I like your art style and you did a nice job with the multiple light sources
Thanks man, I'm glad you noticed the light sources, it was definitely the most challenging part to execute! :)
This picture for some reason struck me with a theme of Majora's Mask. Anyone else?

"What do I do with this?"
*Throws into a magical journey.
Are you use a cintiq or an intuos? And is there a certain burst set you are using that I can get my hands on ;)

I'm using a cintiq, and I can send you my brushes if you'd like :) They're a mix of a bunch of brushes from different artists I admire, and I don't quite know how to use ALL of them yet (there are plenty), but there are a few favorites. 

http://www.mediafire.com/download/izda6tr1qj39qw2/bobbybrushes.abr

The ones I use the most are at the bottom of the set and the first square-blocky brush, but everything in between is great for various textures. Hope that helps!

Cool, thanks. I was using a 21UX but it's not HD and the contrast is weird in general and would have to color adjust on my computer monitor. Stopped for a long time and have been using an intuos 4 recently but I do feel like drawing directly on something works better for my brain as a more traditional artist.
Do a Ryze next :D
pretty awesome art work
